explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2 forbids dead code, which the standard defines as an operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour. Note 2 explicitly distinguishes unreachable code from dead code: unreachable code is not dead code because it cannot be executed. In the shown function the conditional ret = MHD_NO is either (a) not present at all when MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR is not defined (the whole if-block is excluded by #ifdef), or (b) present but uses digest_ext_error(&da) which expands to the constant false so the body is never executed. In case (b) the body is unreachable (never executed), not “dead code” as defined by Rule 2.2. Even if removing that unreachable branch would not change behaviour for that particular build, Rule 2.2 targets executed-but-redundant operations; the code here does not meet that definition. Therefore the claim that this is a Rule 2.2 violation is incorrect.
